subclassFeature.name: Budget Education
entries: Beginning when you select this school at 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy any wizard spell of 3rd level or lower into your spellbook is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Minor Focus
entries: Also when you choose this school at 2nd level, choose one class to minor in from among Bard, Barbarian, Cleric, Druid, Fighter, Monk, Paladin, Ranger, Rogue, Sorcerer, and Warlock.

If you choose {@filter Bard|spells|level=0;1|class=bard}, {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=cleric}, {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=druid}, {@filter Sorcerer|spells|level=0;1|class=sorcerer}, or {@filter Warlock|spells|level=0;1|class=warlock}, you immediately learn two cantrips and one spell of first level or higher from the chosen class' spell list, which are considered wizard spells for you, and you can cast and copy spells from spell scrolls belonging to the chosen class as if they were wizard spells. Spells added by your Minor Focus can not be the target of your {@classFeature Spell Mastery|Wizard||18} feature at 18th level.

Otherwise, you gain one other feature depending on your chosen minor class as shown on the Minor Table below and, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can attack twice instead of once when you take the attack action on your turn:

entries.caption: Minor Table
rows: Gain proficiency in light armor and with one martial weapon. As a bonus action, you gain advantage on the next attack roll you make during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

Gain proficiency in light and medium armor, simple weapons, and in one martial weapon. You also gain one fighting style from the fighter's 1st-level {@classFeature Fightning Style|Fighter||1} feature.
Your movement speed increases by 10 ft. While unarmored and not carrying a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

Gain proficiency in light and medium armor and in one martial weapon. When you hit an enemy with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot of any level to cause the attack to deal 1d6 additional force damage for each of the spell's levels.
Gain proficiency in Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks and with light armor and one martial weapon. You can cast find familiar as a ritual without expending material components.
Gain proficiency in light armor and in Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks. You can disengage or hide as a bonus action on each of your turns.

subclassFeature.name: Cram Study
entries: By 6th level, you have become well-accustomed to accomplishing a week's worth of research in a single day's time. At the end of a short rest, you can replace up to one of your prepared spells with another spell you know.

Additionally, when you use your Arcane Recovery feature at the end of a short rest, the spell slots you regain can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half of your wizard level +2 (rounded down), to a maximum of 5th level.

subclassFeature.name: Adjunct Lessons
entries: At 10th level, you are an expert at learning from the experiences of others—or just copying their notes. If you spend an hour studying the actions of another creature, you become proficient in two skills or tools that creature is proficient in. If that creature has at least one class level, you can instead choose to gain the minor focus corresponding to one of that creature's classes of your choice.

You can only gain the benefits of one Adjunct Lesson at a time, losing any proficencies, spells, or features from your oldest lesson as soon as you gain a new one. Similarly, if you do not observe a creature for at least 10 minutes before the end of each 24 hour period, you lose the benefits of its lesson.

subclassFeature.name: Accelerated Graduation
entries: At 14th level, you complete your introductory studies in wizarding, gaining a cursory knowledge of every field of arcane study. You gain the 2nd level arcane tradition features of two of the following colleges: {@subclassFeature Arcane Ward|Wizard||Abjuration||2||abjuration}, {@subclassFeature Minor Conjuration|Wizard||Conjuration||2||conjuration}, {@subclassFeature Portent|Wizard||Divination||2||divination}, {@subclassFeature Hypnotic Gaze|Wizard||Enchantment||2||enchantment}, {@subclassFeature Sculpt Spells|Wizard||Evocation||2||evocation}, {@subclassFeature Improved Minor Illusion|Wizard||Illusion||2||illusion}, {@subclassFeature Grim Harvest|Wizard||Necromancy||2||necromancy}, and {@subclassFeature Minor Alchemy|Wizard||Transmutation||2||transmutation}. When you finish a long rest, you can choose to replace the 2nd level features of one of these colleges with another college of your choice.
In addition, you receive an enchanted diploma in {@dice 1d10} days which grants you access and some degree of esteem in most libraries, scriptoriums, and universities.
